intro: Andicolea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty andicolea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, dark green leaves with a reddish-brown underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
